elements.title: Cayuga (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the six-year-old steel freighter Cayuga (pictured) was sunk by a wooden freighter twenty years older than her?

elements.title: balloon popping (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that limonene, a compound found in orange peels, can cause balloon popping based on the "like dissolves like" principle?

elements.title: Michael M. Thomas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that it took over a decade for Michael M. Thomas to secure a publisher for his eighth novel, which was rejected by approximately 25 publishing houses?

elements.title: land border with Newfoundland and Labrador (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that on Quebec's maps, the land border with Newfoundland and Labrador must have a separate symbol in the map's legend from other interprovincial boundaries?

elements.title: Shirley Chiang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Shirley Chiang captured the first image of individual benzene molecules?

elements.title: Steinitz's theorem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although Steinitz's theorem is commonly used to describe convex polyhedra using graph theory, its original formulation did not use graphs?

elements.title: Robert McLean (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Robert McLean served as a missionary in Chile for six years before moving to Oregon, where he founded two churches and was elected to the state legislature?

elements.title: a paper-saving typeface (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Philip Rusher patented a paper-saving typeface with no descenders in 1802, but only a few books ever used it?
